measure.CatchLine: Provides that local law regulating sitting, lying, sleeping or keeping warm and dry outdoors on public property that is open to public must be objectively reasonable as to time, place and manner with regards to persons experiencing homelessness.
measure.MeasureSummary:
Provides that local law regulating sitting, lying, sleeping or keeping warm and dry outdoors on public property that is open to public must be objectively reasonable as to time, place and manner with regards to persons experiencing homelessness. Creates affirmative defense to charge of violating such local law that law is not objectively reasonable. Creates cause of action for person experiencing homelessness to challenge objective reasonableness of such local law. Authorizes court to award attorney fees to prevailing plaintiff in such suit in certain circumstances. 
	Declares emergency, effective on passage.
measure.RelatingToFull: Relating to the regulation of public property with respect to persons experiencing homelessness; and declaring an emergency.
measure.RelatingTo: Relating to the regulation of public property with respect to persons experiencing homelessness; and declaring an emergency.

Carried over to April 7, 2021 Calendar by virtue of adjournment.

Rules suspended. Carried over to April 13, 2021 Calendar.
Carried over to April 14, 2021 Calendar by virtue of adjournment.
Carried over to April 15, 2021 Calendar by virtue of adjournment.
Motion to refer to Rules failed.
historyActions.VoteText: Ayes, 23; Nays, 34--Alonso Leon, Bynum, Campos, Dexter, Evans, Fahey, Gomberg, Grayber, Helm, Holvey, Hudson, Kropf, Lively, Marsh, McLain, Meek, Nathanson, Neron, Nosse, Pham, Power, Prusak, Rayfield, Reynolds, Ruiz, Salinas, Sanchez, Schouten, Smith Warner, Sollman, Speaker Kotek, Valderrama, Wilde, Williams; Excused, 2--Clem, Levy; Excused for Business of the House, 1--Drazan.

historyActions.ActionText: Third reading. Carried by Power. Passed.
historyActions.VoteText: Ayes, 35; Nays, 23--Bonham, Boshart Davis, Breese-Iverson, Cate, Drazan, Evans, Gomberg, Hayden, Leif, Lewis, Meek, Moore-Green, Morgan, Nearman, Owens, Post, Reschke, Smith DB, Smith G, Stark, Wallan, Weber, Wright; Excused, 2--Clem, Levy.

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to President's desk.
Referred to Judiciary and Ballot Measure 110 Implementation.
Public Hearing held.
Work Session held.
Recommendation: Do pass.
Second reading.
Third reading.  Carried by Dembrow.  Passed.
historyActions.VoteText: Ayes, 18; Nays, 10--Anderson, Boquist, Findley, Girod, Hansell, Johnson, Linthicum, Robinson, Thatcher, Thomsen; Excused, 2--Heard, Kennemer.

historyActions.ActionText: Speaker signed.
President signed.
Governor signed.
Chapter 370, (2021 Laws): Effective date June 23, 2021.
